context: Pesticides can be classified based upon their <b4_0>biological mechanism function or <a0_0>application method<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Most pesticides work <a1_0>by <b7_0>poisoning<b7_0/> pests<a1_0/>. A systemic pesticide moves inside a plant following absorption by the plant. With insecticides and most fungicides, this <a2_0>movement is <b5_0>usually upward<a2_0/> (through the xylem) and outward<b5_0/>. <b6_0>Increased efficiency<b6_0/> may be a result. Systemic insecticides, which poison <a3_0>pollen and nectar in the <b8_0>flowers<b8_0/><a3_0/>[citation needed], may kill bees and other needed pollinators[citation needed].
